Reviews.Title: “like at home”
Reviews.Author: Jaroslav D
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay in Istanbul. Great location and MAINLY very friendly and helpfull staff. Big thank to Mr.Burhan to create atmosphere like at home.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: javad79
Reviews.Content: very clean ,perfect management, friendly stuff ,fantastic location that it's close to all tourist attraction helpful reception with perfect turkish breakfast and good value . i have been there two times. aylin

Reviews.Title: “Look no further for your Istanbul Hotel”
Reviews.Author: twilight76
Reviews.Content: This is where you want to stay. I travel alone almost everywhere I go so it was wonderful to have such friendly staff that were always welcoming and helpful but never intrusive. They went above and beyond for even the smallest request. I worked in luxury travel sales and used to represent a Four Seasons hotel so always offer small tips wherever I stay. My shower head wasn't mounted properly so I mentioned that I'd found a solution (anchoring it with my hairbrush) but that they might want to have it fixed before the next guest arrived. It was fixed when I returned to my room that afternoon. Another day, I returned with a black radish which I was fascinated by because I'd never seen one before and Erdi not only cut it up for me but sat with me to eat it and prepared the other one with honey to sit overnight, something they do in Turkey for colds, and presented it to me in the morning. It's little touches like those that make a trip even more memorable. Plus you really can't beat the location. Within walking distance of the biggest sights - Aya Sofia, Tokapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, the Cistern, ferries to the eastern side and around the corner from a tram station it's a perfect base for your Istanbul adventure.

Reviews.Title: “nice trip”
Reviews.Author: Mitra s s
Reviews.Content: It was so clean and comfort. Its staff and specially receptions was very excellent and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: axehigh
Reviews.Content: This is a nice and small hotel, with about 15 rooms, but what really brings this hotel out is its excellent staff and especially the receptionist Erdi - he alone made our stay in Istanbul a very pleasant experience. We arrived late and were greeted by Erdi which did nothing but smile and was very patient when explaining to us some of the sights to see - at 1 am. They realised we had travelled for some time and whipped up some refreshing drinks and gave us some Turkish delights for energy. We were also upgraded from a double to a triple room for some extra space. During the entire stay at the Hotel Adora, if there was anything, Erdi would help us. He also helped us when we needed arranging the Florence Nightingale museum, which apparently not everyone have heard about. The breakfast buffet is simple, but for us it was an excellent choice since we also wanted to try the Turkish (breakfast) cuisine at other places. We had the breakfast 2-3 days, then went out in the city for breakfast the other days (and could sleep a bit longer :). The rooms are nice and tidy and you get a good night sleep - even though the hotel is located close to Gulhane tramstation which makes it even more ideal to have as a starting point. Walking distance to some of major sightseeings (less than 5 minutes), and with access to the tram you can also easily visit the Biggest Shopping Mall in Europe. So, something for everyone! And of course, when we left we got a small surprise package from the Hotel. A very nice surprise! Thanks Erdi@Adora Oddie&LiLing

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canan C
Reviews.Content: the location is perfect, ideal for a city trip. everything can be reached by foot, but gÃ¼lhane station is also just a few steps away. the staff was very friendly and helpful. rooms are small but clean and quiet. great breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: Leonie S
Reviews.Content: ADORA is a really nice hotel!!! great breakfast-buffet... rooms are small but pretty and cosy. really friendly staff: thanks to Burhan for making our stay so memorable!! we will definetly come back! the location of the hotel is excellent: very close to alle the major tourist sites in the old town, but also quiet enough to sleep well at night...

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Adora”
Reviews.Author: KarenbDublin
Reviews.Content: I am just back to Ireland after a week's holiday in Istanbul, and I would certainly recommend the Adora Hotal for an perfectly located, inexpensive and very friendly hotel to stay in. The hotel is small in size, but very homely all the same. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. Particularly as my luggage was lost on the way to Istanbul, and Burhan helped me all week trying to locate it... to no avail however :(( (carry hand luggage when travelling lufthansa!). Thanks for all the help Burhan! Karen

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, great staff, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: vak88
Reviews.Content: The location for the Adora hotel was great. Lots of sites of the old district were within walking distance and the tram was right near by too. Restaurants very close by too if you didn't want to stray to far at night. The actual room (3 person accommodation, double + single) was really nice too. Enough space to move about and very nice and clean. Comfortable sleep and breakfast included (good variety and not the usual western continental style). Staff was very friendly and helpful through out the stay. Cleaning staff even folded some clothes that I had left on my bed! I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location!”
Reviews.Author: RetepCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small indeed. Our doublebed was in a 10 sq.mtr. Room. But it was ok. The place is clean and quiet. Almost disappointed not to hear more of the calls for prayer! Staff are very helpfull and friendly. Breakfast is what you can expect - basic but ok, for the three days we were there they did an effort to bring som variety. Best thing is location. Ideal for exploring Sultanahmet by foot and for crossing Galata bridge to Beyoglu. If not in walking mode the tram is just round the corner. We came in March - cold season and happy that room was warm and bath functioned! Our cost was â‚¬50 a noght and I found that excellent value,

Reviews.Title: “Very central location, lovely hotel, great customer service, excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: nitakamdar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Adora Hotel for four nights at our first visit to istanbul. My daughter picked this hotel for us after reading the excellent reviews, and we were certainly not disappointed. The hotel is located very close to all the historical monuments, the Grand Bazaar and the sea side. Erdi made us feel most welcome and helped us plan our day to day itinerary for visiting places, including evening shows. He was very helpful throughout our stay and made us feel at home. Breakfast in the mornings is excellent with a wide choice to suit all. The room with ensuite bathroom was very clean and comfortable and tea and coffee are available 24 hours/day. We highly recommend this hotel for all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in friendly atmopshere”
Reviews.Author: Roman J
Reviews.Content: I booked hotel room through the hotel website and was satisfied this on-line service. Hotel is located in a nice place in historical center of Istanbul near Archeological Museum, Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sofia, service was excellent! I was met in airport and transfer service was quick and easy. The room was comfortable with wi-fi internet access, TV set and etc. The manager of the hotel Mr. Burhan is very pleasant, polite and friendly person who provided me all information needed. I recommend to stay in this hotel, at least I will stay there in future.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: 335GUP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Adora for five nights at our first visit to Istanbul. We are so happy that we chose the small and cosy hotel Adora. Here are some reasons: * The staff: from the first till the last minute we were greeted with warm smiles and friendliness that made us feel at home. Erdi and Burhan at the front desk were always willing to help and created a good atmosphere. * The location: It was easy to use the metro and the tram all the way from the airport to the hotel.(about 50 minutes) You just buy 4 jetons in the automat and use two for the metro and then change in Zeitinburnu and use two for the tram. People are always willing to help! The hotel is very close to many major sites ( Top Kapi, Hagya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Cisterns) and you can easily walk across Galata Bridge to explore Beyoglu or take a ferry to Asia or walk to the bazars. The complimentary breakfast: We enjoyed the variety: cheeses,tasty olives, meat, vegetables, marmelades, honey,fresh bread, yoghurt, cereales.......... The room: always clean, quiet and heated on chilly february days. There was a safe and free access to use the Internet. The price: You really get much for your money. DonÂ´t hesitate - choose Adora and youÂ´ll have a nice stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Search no more, Adora Hotel is your choice!”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoJunior
Reviews.Content: Well, nothing more than feel at home while travelling. Ozkan and all the staff made me fell in home while there. Always talking like a friend, giving all the infos I need, helping me with everything. They really know how to make a warm and close connection with the guests without being invasive. The hotel itself is very well located, within few steps to any kind of thing you might need (ATMs, stores, restaurants, etc) and also to the train station and the touristic places like Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque. The rooms are very well protected from sound and outside temperatures and even when I got 0ÂºC I could sleep tight and warm. The rooms are tiny but well equiped and serviced and everything worked fine. Wireless free internet available and intl channels on TV. ThatÂ´s an old building but well kept and mantained. The breakfast is incredible with everything fresh and tasty and worked fine for your first meal of the day. Just donÂ´t forget to have your electrical AC power adaptors once thereÂ´s only Europe style sockets in the room. I absolutely recommend this property to everyone and this will be my only option when is Istanbul again. Thanks Adora staff!

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Adora/Burhan/Adora Team”
Reviews.Author: Sumit D
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much Hotel adora, Burhan and the entire team for making our stay at adora hotel simply superb. We cannot have imagined before the type of caring and affection we received from the entire hotel adora team. Our stay in istanbul felt like home. Definitely the best and most economic place to stay in Istanbul. It was real fun being in the classic old town of Sultanahmet, amidst the adora.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Walid F
Reviews.Content: I Spend one week in this hotel fantasy, It Is very clean, very quite, all rooms are Newly furniture, nice and warm decor; Varied and delicious breakfast, all the staff are more kind Than They Are sooo helpful and very friendly , It Is near to tram station, shopping area (glossary, supermarket, pharmacy, banks, food outlets, sweet shops, home equipment, clothes and shoes shops, restaurant, airport transfer, Turkish Bath and Spa Also and I Will not forget to say it Comparing price is very good with I Have Been Other hotels in Istanbul Before, I recommend to Spend holidays in this marvelous fantastic hotel, thanks for all the staff with special thanks to BURHAN, Truly I Did enjoy my trip ADORA :)))) )

Reviews.Title: “My Second Home!”
Reviews.Author: JRefundo
Reviews.Content: Being outside your comfort zone is not really easy, but i didnt feel it @ Adora Hotel, It felt that you are just home. Staffs are so nice and accommodating that you quickly feel comfortable with them from the moment you check-in. Location wise, it was so accessible to most of the tourist attractions by walking distance. Definitely my choice for my future visit. Thank you especially to Erdi and Ozkan for making our stay in Adora an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: Katsu M
Reviews.Content: The warm welcome when we arrive at the Hotel was really great. Erdi was very helpful assisting us where we can go during our visit in Istanbul and how to get those lovely places. All through out our stay the staff are really nice. They always great you with a smile which makes you feel you're at home. They would be very pleased to help you if you need anything. We really appreciate Erdi for being kind and nice to us which makes our stay comfortable. Thanks also to Ozkan for being good and helpful to us. To the rest of the staff, sorry I could not remember your names....you guys are fantastic!!! I would highly recommend Adora Hotel if you visit Istanbul. Not only the place is very near to the beautiful places of Istanbul but the service and the staff are excellent. Extremely beyond our expectation what Adora Hotel had offered throughout our stay. You guys are awesome!!! Zy (Zaineth)

Reviews.Title: “adora hotell best of hotel”
Reviews.Author: vahid m
Reviews.Content: personal gozal borhan bay chok tashekor edrim uromya da vahid

Reviews.Title: “Modest and good”
Reviews.Author: Gia L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you're looking for an inexpensive accommodation in the historic center of the city. It provides all the basic services a traveler might need and even has some charm. The staff is really helpful and they DO speak English.

Reviews.Title: “One of the MOST CONVENIENT hotels in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Peyman1982
Reviews.Content: ADORA is a root of word "Adorable" which means extremely charming, lovable (Merriam-Webster) - Hotel is placed in a calm and beautiful part of istanbul - Most of the tourism attractions are only walk away from hotel - The staff are very friendly and helpful, you will find the most RAPID check in - check out - Although the hotel is placed in a small area, and has 15 rooms, rooms are very clean and well ordered and A PERFECT SERVICE is delivered to the rooms. - The breakfast is delicious, having a complete range of drinks, breads, dairy, others. - even if you have nothing to do, walking in hotel surrounding could be enjoyable. - you have a quick access to tram station, so the transportation to various istanbul locations is more easy than you think, in less than 30 minutes you can get to taksim sq., istiklal ave., aksaray, istanbul forum, seaside, galata bridge, galata tower,... - you can find premium quality foods, gift shops, supermarkets around hotel. - you will probably suggest ADORA to others as I suggest to you ;) Peyman Alimardani

Reviews.Title: “A Magnificent Hotel with Wonderful Staff - especially Erdi”
Reviews.Author: James R
Reviews.Content: The Adora hotel is absolutely wonderful with a prime location. It is merely a one minute walk from the tram and a five-fifteen minute walk to Hagia Sophia, the Byzantine Cistern Museum, the Archaeology Museum, Tokapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, and the Hippodrome. To make matters better? Breakfast is great and the staff is amazingly accomodating, helpful, and nice. Although everyone at the hotel were excellent, Erdi took it to the next level. His help made all the difference. I would recommend ANYONE going to Istanbul to go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ana_nara
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent a week in Adora hotel on New Year holidays 2011-2012. We are very satisfied and can highly recommend it! The location is perfect: in the historical center of the city, on the street with lots of restaurants, cafes and shops. All main cultural attractions are in walking distance, as well as the sea and bazars. The street itself is pleasantly quite, so no noises will disturb you. The hotel itself is just awesome! Rooms are small, but nice, elegant and clean. The greatest thing about Adora is its stuff. I would like to thank personally 2 guys working on reception - Erdi and Burhan. They are the most responsive, responsible and enthusiastic about their job people I have ever met in hotels! Well done, guys! You have made our holidays just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “The most helpful hotel staff ever”
Reviews.Author: Anna S
Reviews.Content: A wonderful homely hotel in the heart of Istanbul within a short distance from all the main sightseeings, clean and comfortable, with everything a traveller needs. One of the main advantages of the hotel is professional and extremely caring hotel staff represented by Erdi and Burhan, who would always give you a valuable advice and solve all kind of problems you might have outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best budget hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tanja015
Reviews.Content: I spent a great time in Adora hotel and am going to come back on my next trip to this beautiful city. For me the most important thing is that you can open the window so you can leave fresh air into the room. This is usually not possible even when you find yourself in a 5 star hotel. And the second important thing is the radiator in the room which this hotel has. I just hate the hot air blowing out from air conditioning while the floor remains cold. The rooms are clean and I just loved the mattresse, it is just the way I like it. Not too soft. And the hotel is just a few steps away from the main sights in Istanbul, Topkapi, Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. So for small money I got maximum I need on a journey away from my home. And the staff is sooo helpful and friendly. Always in a good mood. But the best of them is Erdi, he should be voted for best receptionist of Istanbul hotels. Good luck Adora !

Reviews.Title: “Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Methusala
Reviews.Content: From the welcome of apple juice and Turkish Delight to the general friendly service - all very good. You have to be happy with compact, but the facilities are goodenough and the breakfast is great. You could hardly be better placed for many main sites in walking distance and the tram station round the corner. Tram and Metro to the airport in less than an hour for 4 TL or less.

Reviews.Title: “adora hotel service”
Reviews.Author: scorggiz
Reviews.Content: We (family of 3) enjoyed our holiday in Istanbul n our stay at Adora Hotel. The hotel is small, yet cosy n the ambience was warm with friendly staff offering you Turkish or apple tea while you wait at the lobby. The manager, Burhan, was always smiling, helpful n friendly. He will offer you tips about the area n Turkish tea while you wait for your friend/s or love one/s. His colleagues were equally warm n friendly n their service prompt. Hotel is well located within walking distance from Topkapi Palace, Hajjah Sofia, the Blue Mosque n the Grand Bazaar. Good hotel to stay at when you are in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel with friendly & helpful service, great value”
Reviews.Author: ABethC
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. The staff provided a very nice breakfast, helped us make travel arrangements and a reservation at the hammam. The location is absolutely perfect in the old city within a short walking distance of Sultanahmet Square and lots of great restaurants. The only downfall was that the room was deceptively tiny and the bed was very uncomfortable. The mattress sort of slumped to one side. One big tip that I would give to any traveler is to take advantage of the airport transfer service. The Istanbul airport was a madhouse when we arrived, so it was a huge relief to immediately spot our driver to get us out of there quickly. The same driver even drove us back to airport at 4am on the day we left. I believe it was something like 20 euro each way...which was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: Brenda C
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, across from the Topkapi Palace and 2 blocks from the entrance to the Archeological Museum. The hotel is older and not elaborate, but safe, clean and has a wonderful staff, especially Burhan, who were willing to answer all our questions. We couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the heart of the tourist area”
Reviews.Author: JavaMama58
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 adults just spent 5 nights (Nov 2011) at the Adora hotel. and have nothing but wonderful things to say about the place. I booked the hotel entirely based on Trip Advisor ratings and took the plunge based on the reviews I'd read, their location, availability, breakfast included and their special offer for free one way complimentary airport pick-up. The internet response to my booking came quickly and efficiently. The room on the 5th floor was clean and adequate for our needs. Breakfast was included in the rate and that was really a great selection. Breakfast was not only bread and cheese, but a varieyt of breads and cheeses, fruits, juices, olives, boiled and scrambled eggs and sausages. The small hotel is centrally located a min from a tram station and right across the street from the side entrance of the Topkapi palace and very easily within a no sweat leisurely walk to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar, Egyptian Spice Market, Bosphorus Tours, New Mosque. The room had everything we needed, a safe, refrigerator and even a little corner to have our luggage and a vanity table & in room and dining room internet. My only comment for improvement is that they need better lighting in the bathroom. Best of all the staff was over and beyond helpful and friendly. They went out of their way to contact us at the airport where we were waiting for our daughter who had missed her flight. We waited in vain at 2 am in the airport not knowing this and when our daughter in desperation called them from Paris, they went out of their way to contact us via the hotel pick-up person and waited till we finally got to the hotel, ready to assist with anything we needed. They deserve a medal for their dedication to the cause. They patiently explained instructions for getting wherever we needed to go. The staff get 5 stars and a big thank you for their patience and fantastic can do attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Rochet
Reviews.Content: We spent a total of 6 nights in this hotel, 4 in the beginning of our trip and 2 at the end. The hotel is small and the staff is very helpful. Breakfast is included and is a good typical Turkish breakfast. One of the best things about it is the location. Walking distance from Topkapi palace, the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia the Galata bridge and even closer to a tram stop. Just a great location. In our first visit we were in a "triple room" which was a reasonable size and comfortable. The last two nights were in a "double room" which was pretty small but still comfortable. No problems with the I don't know if you can do better for the price

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: J R
Reviews.Content: Hotel Adora was really an excellent choice: Location -- around the corner from the metro; with the windows closed, it was not close enough to be noisy, but close enough to be within walking distance. If you pick a hotel right on the main line, there tends to be clanging sounds. Hotel was also within walking distance to all the important sites, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, etc., also within 10-15 min. to Eminonu. Scenery along the street of the metro is very charming and picturesque so that the walk is not boring. Most importantly, it is located in a very nice area so that walking at night feels very safe. There were several young women staying alone at the hotel. Restaurants along the metro are more expensive, but not necessarily better. Hotel is also within 5-10 min. walk of some really cheap and good eateries; we were able to buy fresh squeezed orange juice for 1TYL at some cafes. Staff -- really the gem of the place. The manager Erdi and the staff were friendly, funny, and helpful. Even just walking by us while we were waiting for the elevator, they would take the time to press the elevator button for us. They made the entire experience very warm and friendly. Our flight was at 2pm, but they allowed us to have a late checkout. In general, the people in Istanbul have a great sense of humor and are always trying to joke with you. If you have been in hotels in which it felt like you owed the staff something, then this hotel will really be a great experience. Hotel Services -- Can't complain too much about this place because they gave us room upgrade, and our room ended up being quite sizable for us. Also, the airport shuttle used by the hotel is only 50TYL, which was the cheapest that I would've found by myself, so they definitely didn't add any additional fees. It is charming and quaint in its decorations; there is heater, a/c, and hot water; and it is very clean. However, do note that this is an older hotel so it does feel more like an authentic experience than staying at a Hilton. Local Sites -- Topkapi Palace was not as great as everyone says that it is; extremely crowded and even though you are not supposed to smoke on the grounds, tourists stink up the place and some of the guards also do as well. The Harem is also not as great as claimed -- not that many rooms are open and there is no furniture as in the Dolmabahce Palace -- only good thing about the place is that fewer people are in there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but don't plan on a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: AndreaT-VA
Reviews.Content: I really wish I could write a good review because the staff at the Adora was wonderful. However, the mattress was hard as a rock, the room was either freezing cold or swelteringly hot, the shower ran all night (not just dripped, but actually ran), and the heating unit vibrated and shook so that my husband and I were unable to sleep a wink. The hotel owner needs to do some major upgrades: new mattresses, new heating units, and plumbing repairs. Even though the location is wonderful, the hotel was not cheap, and it was definitely NOT worth what we paid. I would have gladly paid more per night to stay in a place where we could get some sleep. We stayed for three nights at the end of two weeks in Turkey, and we ended up going home utterly exhausted. I cannot recommend this hotel. People staying at Adora were asking for new rooms, but the new were as bad as the old. We saw at least two parties leave early to go to other area hotels. It's a shame as the rooms were clean, though quite small, and it has a lot of potential. I hope the owner will invest some money to make it livable.

Reviews.Title: “you can have good with reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: EERO42
Reviews.Content: We have travelled in 40 countries and 100`s of hotels. We were 2 weeks in Istanbul - nice time to be! Adora is a hotel of top 20 on our list - believe or not. After first week we understood it in real practice They do all, what you are asking them to do for you - that is our number One experience of their service. Because I made my 30s marathon here, we needed a guiet room and we got it When we sended an Email 4 months before our trip and they responded soon and fullfilled our needs then and later. Staff was very polite and helpful all the time.So if you smiled they smile and if you demand, they respond. This is a good hotel on exellent area of Istanbul. We recommend you to use public traffic of the city. By Istanbulkart (Abkilpass) you can travel with trams and boats very easely.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist Hotels Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Hassan R
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the main sites (Topkapi,Saint Sophia, Blue Mosque & Grand Bazaar) , just a 15 -20 minute walk, it is also on the tram route to across the Golden Horn. The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and typical of a tourist hotel where you are just going to sleep. The restaurant (Faros) is right next door and the food is superb... see separate review. Both my daughter and I would return to Istanbul and stay at the Adora Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Adora Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Karen G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights and the location is perfect - walking distance to the tram and most of the major attractions, including Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque and the Spice Mart. My room was tiny but very clean and comfortable; the bathroom was large by comparison and had a great shower. The cleaning crew makes up the beds and changes the towels daily, which did not happen at any other place I stayed in Turkey. Breakfast was perfect -- self-service on the drinks (also not the norm, and I need at least 3 cups of tea to wake up) and a wide selection of food, both cold and hot. But the best part of the Adora is the staff -- just the nicest, friendliest people we met, especially Burhan Erbas, who greeted us with drinks and Turkish Delight as soon as we arrived. Thanks to everyone for the great hospitality -- I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rohit K
Reviews.Content: Adora is a great hotel for all budget conscious travelers - very friendly staff, including one rather intelligent and well informed manager with whom I had a great conversation on Turkey's history and culture, and place in modern society. The staff was very welcoming and helpful with where to get money changed and so on. Apparently, the owner treats his staff well and it shows. The hotel manager, Umit, was very gracious about everything too. The breakfast is generous, unlimited and has decent variety - but gets repetitive - but I am not complaining. The rooms are tiny - just enough room for a decent, comfortable bed and a small but clean bathroom - but well worth the price and location. The hotel itself is on a very cute cobblestone street that is quiet and makes you feel at home immediately. Overall, this was excellent and I'd stay here again if I wanted to keep to the same budget. Locationwise, I would prefer this to the Sultanahmet area because this is closer to the Asian side too. The hotel's location is absolutely superb. It's a very very short walk away from the tram line, a very short walk to the Sultanahmet area (Cemberlitas Hamam, Basilica Cistern, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Topkapi, Haggia Sofia, Grand Bazaar, Archaeological Museum - highly recommended, Islamic Museum, and so on) and a very short walk in the opposite direction to the Spice Market, the Bosphorous River (the Eminonu dock from where you can take a 2 hour river cruise - highly recommended - for 12 lira), Galata Bridge, and lovely eateries in a corner by-lane just 10 meters away from the hotel. For those who love to walk, the hotel is close enough to walk across Galata bridge, up a curving hill to Galata Tower, and on to Tunel, Istiklal Street (with its rocking night life and character-full alleys with pubs and live bands), all the way to Taksim Square, and then a downhill walk back. Or, you can very conveniently take the tram back to the hotel. I'd also recommend a tram to Dolmabahace Palace - pick this over Topkapi if you're short on time.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming, convenient home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Judy N
Reviews.Content: The room was small but the staff was incredible. A friend and I stayed here for one week and couldn't have been treated better. The young men were helpful, fun, attentive and friendly. It was hard to leave!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay with nice people”
Reviews.Author: TripFairy
Reviews.Content: I just want to tell you how welcoming is this hotel. This is a small hotel with very clean rooms and a very very good location. It's located right beside the GÃ¼lhane tram stop, and it is as close from Hagia Sofia than it is from EminÃ¶nÃ¼ and Galata Bridge. Breakfast was nice, tea and coffee is included all the day and you can ask for an airport drop or pick-up. It is sometimes included depending of how many nights you booked. The staff was super ! Just for the staff I would definitively choose this hotel again. It's a personalized service, and because I was a solo traveller, I really appreciated it. I felt safe, and a little bit like at home. They have free wifi. It's important to mention it.

Reviews.Title: “The staff are incredible!”
Reviews.Author: Carla D
Reviews.Content: The staff went out of their way to be helpful. I needed help with finding the village of my grandfather and they did everything they could and did, indeed, find out about the village and helped with translation. They also found someone in the village to help me when I come back to visit. My friend and I stayed for 7 nights and it really did feel like home. I loved seeing the staff and laughing and talking with them. I didn't know that such politeness was still in existance. They even anticipated our needs and met them without asking. Although the rooms were small by USA standards - they were fine and clean. The location was superb and I wouldn't change anything. The Adora is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hotel High Price”
Reviews.Author: Lycaenidae
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. The rooms are lovely decorated, all in white, but VERY small. We stayed at a triple room the first 4 nights and a double the last night, and both rooms were very small. There is no place for the luggage and yourself at the same time. The bathrooms are ok .The wifi connection is TERRIBLE, we could never connect to the hotel net, we had to use the neighbourÂ´s. The pc at the lobby is always busy, so it is very difficult to use it. The location is great, the hotel is very near the tram and the restaurants, which makes it very easy to move arround the city. Breakfast is not so good, not many choices. The service at the reception is very good, they helped us with the directions and taxiÂ´s. But room cleaning not so much, one day we came back at night and the room was not done, towels were wet, beds unmade. We stayed so many nights just because the others hotels we knew were full and we didnÂ´t want to spend a day going arround Istanbul looking for a room. The price doesnÂ´t match the quality. I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Adora Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AtlanticCoast
Reviews.Content: While in Istanbul, I stayed at the Adora Boutique Hotel. The cost was very reasonable and included a shuttle transfer from the airport. The hotel is conveniently located near a tramway stop (Gulhane) and near the Basilica Cistern, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Museum. It is also a pleasant 10 minute walk to the Eminonou port and the nearby Spice Bazaar. There are several restaurants and pastry shops nearby as well. I stayed in two different rooms at the Adora. The beds were very comfortable. The rooms are cleaned every day and are spotless. In fact, the cleanliness of the room and bathroom is something that stands out in a positive way. I ran my fingers over some of the more obscure edges of the room and no dust in sight. The rooms are not small nor are they very large. My room had a full size bed and a twin bed as well as a dresser a closet and a safe. Every electrical item in the room functioned properly. There were no fused bulbs, the showers worked well as did the air conditioner. The three receptionists (Burhan, Erdi and Ozkan) were tremendously helpful. They gave me excellent directions to various places. They made the reservations for me and also gave good suggestions for restaurants and sightseeing. They were always friendly and patient and I enjoyed having friendly conversations with them. I hope to visit Istanbul again and would definitely stay at the Adora Boutique Hotel. I have already recommended this hotel to my parents.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience”
Reviews.Author: AnuP2D
Reviews.Content: Location is great....right at the center of the old city. Room was large, but had no character...dull uninviting decor and lacked basic stuff like dustbins! Staff was extremely helpful however. Breakfast was average

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hosts”
Reviews.Author: Gurtus
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in Sep 2011 and since we were short on time for sightseeing, we found the location of the hotel perfect. Its right next to the tram station and only 1 stop away from the blue mosque and hagia sophia and only 2 stops to from the port for the boshorous cruise(all are within walking distance). There are lots of restaurants and sovenier shops located on the same street as the hotel. Breakfast is typically turkish and wonderful. There is complimentary tea and coffee available in the lobby all day. There is a computer terminal with internet access in the lobby as well. The staff are very helpful and friendly. They took care of all our needs and even gave us a free tarot reading session:) The rooms are very tiny but extremely functional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service”
Reviews.Author: AntonKiev_Ukraine
Reviews.Content: Besides very good location (just one tram station to the most popular square in Istanbul, Aya-Sofiya and Blue mosque) it's very cozy inside. Hostel gas perfect service and helpful reception always up to help you or entertain to tea if you have time to talk and relax. Anton (Kiev, Ukraine)

Reviews.Title: “Another positive review!”
Reviews.Author: Tim W
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our visit to Istanbul enormously, not least because we had such a good hotel to return to! Perfect location for all the sights in the Sultanahmet area, it's also only one tram stop down to the sea and to either the Boshphorus or the Golden Horn. We would certainly recommend taking the famous Boshphorous Tour. Burhane and the team were very attentive tthroughout and I was particularly grateful to Hakan for his medical skills when feeling a little under-the-weather. Spotless rooms, good mix of Turkish and Arabic TV and Al-Jazeerah International - what else could a couple want?!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: upstatetraveler
Reviews.Content: On a three week trip to Turkey mid-May thru early June my wife and I stayed at the Adora Hotel for four days at the beginning of our trip and three days at the end. We could not have made a better choice. Besides the cleanlliness, friendliness and great breakfast we were only steps from the easy to use tram and just ten minutes walk from Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkopi Palace. The location could not have been better, Many wonderful restaurant options within easy walking distance. The staff was extremely helpful and the free shuttle service from the airport (included with several days stay) puts it over the top. Great in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Very courteous, very practical!”
Reviews.Author: rohitsharing
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s a no fuss boutique hotel with very welcoming & helpful staff. Right from the early booking stage till the time we left I had no problem whatsoever. They are as humane as professional. At the booking stage Umit (one of their staff) was very supportive, at the same time efficient with necessary confirmation & paperwork. That does take off a lot of hassles & uncertainty. Later when we reached there Burhan (yet another staff member) guided us well with where to go, how to go, where to eat, etc. From the location perspective it is a wise choice, as this is right between Sultanahment attractions on one side & Bosphorus tour attractions on the other, both at a walkable distance & very easy tram access.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: AliceALOMAR
Reviews.Content: We had great time in the faboulous city!This is the first time staying at Adora Hotel Sirkeci , and I love the atmosphere and the location of the hotel.It's very close to Sultanahmet. We always feel welcome when staying there, employees were so warm and they helped us. Especially Ozkan was a great employee, he was fun and very friendly all the time. Also nice and clean rooms, breakfast was okay.I'd like to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super awesome staff, clean rooms, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: misswhitneypaige
Reviews.Content: For the location, I would rate this an excellent choice, though the rooms are admittedly not 4-star but are cozy and clean. The staff more than makes up for it though and were endlessly helpful and friendly, both with me and my husband and with the larger group of friends who also stayed in the hotel for 4 nights. E.g., the staff even offered beverages to other friends who were not guests of the hotel-- super nice and never seemed to be expecting a tip. I'd also say it's worth paying slightly more to stay here right in the middle of things. Overall we were very happy we landed at Adora.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location, would definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: katNY10009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adora Hotel for a total of 6 nights and would definitely recommend it to travelers looking for a great location at an affordable price. The rooms are small, but very clean and nicely decorated. The staff is super helpful, always available and very friendly. Breakfast is included and is very good. The hotel is one block from public transportation which makes it easy to get around the city to Galata Tower, Taksim Square etc...and you can easily walk (less than 10min) to all the major tourist sites too.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ayseren2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8nights. The most greatful this hotel is the hotel staff. They are really kind, helpful and friendly. My husband always spent chatting with them till late. They prepared a baby cot for my daughter, also everyday cared about her! Room is bit small but enough and clean. Breakfast was typical Turkish style, we loved it. Refreshment are available anytime. Highly recommend to stay here! You will have great memory in istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Steps to all the sights and a tranquil hotel at the end of your day”
Reviews.Author: JandSNyc
Reviews.Content: Located on a pedestrian street, the Adora is walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, the Basilica Cistern, the Grand Bazaar, Spice Market and more. It is a fabulous location at a great price. The lobby bar and restaurant are intimate and welcoming and serve a lovely breakfast. The rooms are spotless with wonderful showers. Mr. Gul and his staff are most welcoming. We stayed 6 nights and were sorry to have to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: christien_drost
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the hotel. The drinks and refreshments were great, especially the complementary carrot and cucumber sticks. Breakfast was ok and the hotel is located ideally. The staff were very helpfull and two of them accompanied us on our last evening out in town.

Reviews.Title: “Tipped off by daughter-made the right choice.”
Reviews.Author: Craig08108
Reviews.Content: I had originally planned to stay in another place, but my daughter had stayed there before and said we should choose this hotel. What a location. From the Hagia Sofia to the Blue Mosque to the docks it only took 10 to 15 minutes to walk to each. We were greated with juice and a treat, overwhelming kindness and an upgraded room. Yes, the rooms are small but most reasonable rooms are small in Europe. Plus we really only slept in the room so a huge size wasn't needed. When we left, we were given Turkish Delight. Overall, a very pleasant experience. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it completely”
Reviews.Author: papri
Reviews.Content: Wow,amazing hotel in an amazing location with an awesome hospitality. Coaxed in a cosy and picturesque lane, the Boutique Adora hotel spells a romantic stay in Istanbul. Located in the heart of the city where the major monuments are just a walk away, the hotel offers all what you require as a tourist- great rate, good rooms with good room service, great food and a great hospitality. The management is quite responsible for the guests who stay there and never fall short of helping and guiding. Great Job Guys and thank you for making it special for us.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: DipteshGhosh
Reviews.Content: It was one of my best experiences in a hotel, the staff were very friendly, and gave good advise whenever we asked. The hotel's location was also great --10 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque. This will be my hotel of choice if I go back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, that's about it...”
Reviews.Author: sweet_431
Reviews.Content: As noted the Adora is conveniently located in Sultanahmet so it is close to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, the Spice Market, etc, but there are so many hotels in this area that I'm certain there are better options for a comparable price. Our room was very small, outdated, not very clean and reeked like cigarette smoke, which was constantly wafting in from the outside patio. We also had problems with the air conditioner not working very well and making a lot of noise. The buffet breakfast was the same strange stuff each day and offered very little in the way of fresh food. The hotel staff were a little too friendly and were actually a nuisance at times, such as when you just wanted to sit on the patio or use the Internet. The room was also noisy as it faced the main road with the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly polite staff and a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: metz36
Reviews.Content: We booked a package holiday online and chose the Adora Hotel. The staff were very helpful even before our arrival. They recommended a shuttle bus from the airport (Havas) and gave detailed directions to their lovely hotel. The welcome was warm and professional and our room (though small) was spotlessly clean. There was a little noise from the nearby tram stop, but nothing too disruptive. The included continental breakfast was a nice bonus, as it made for an easy start each morning. The real gem here are the hotel staff. The guys were super friendly and helpful. One of our shirts went missing in the laundry service, but they were able to sort it out and find it. Thank you! Do yourself a huge favour and reserve a table at the Imbat Rooftop terrace restaurant down the road (amazing food, service and views)! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: invisibulman
Reviews.Content: Very quaint hotel. Room was a little on the small side... made it tough to unpack. Staff was nice and location was good. Spent about an hour trying to find it from the Serkeci train station because no one seemed to be able to tell us where it was. Should have just gotten off at Guhlane and it was right around the corner. Overall I would recommend this hotel as we got it atfor a price far better than other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Adored the Adora”
Reviews.Author: MJ_SG2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adora hotel for 4 days and had an exceptional service. All staff members were very friendly and helpful. We loved the breakfast which provided a lot of options and the unlimited teas and coffees we enjoyed. Our room was always clean when we came back and the housekeeper was very polite and efficient. We were presented with boxes of Turkish delight when we checked out. Strongly recommend this hotel! Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoable stay in an interesting area!”
Reviews.Author: lizandjo
Reviews.Content: Adroa is a very special hotel and it feels as if you have just walked into the old Istanbul. Although we have stayed in better hotels around the world, this is one place that I felt that we had to write a review about. Very helpful staff and a real customer orientated hotel. The smell of musk in the rooms is gorgeous and everything is very clean. It is not your typical full service city hotel but it is worth the experience. Our youngest daughter had some complaints because we are used to spending the summer by the beach making friends, so next time we will leave them at home. hahaha Try it for yourselves and you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: skeyan
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Awesome location. Good breakfast and comfortable beds. small but very charming rooms. hotel staff very nice and helped me with the planning and booking of activities during my trip. Made a very positive impression on the whole trip. Looking forward to my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Adora - Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Yulyalka
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to Adora Hotel it was just 8 a.m. (5 hours to our check-in time) we were kindly offered to have a breakfast while it actually wasn't payed by us. And at 10 a.m. we're already sleeping in our room. The location is perfect. All of the attractions are located nearly. So you can reach everything even on foot. The tram station is in 50 meters to the hotel. That's why it didn't make difficulty to get anywhere. Every time we returned to our room it was carefully cleaned and aired. Staff is really the best. The boys didn't offered to help but helped with everything. Great thanks to them. We had our plane late in the evening, so we left our luggage with the hotel. In the end we were presented with 2 boxes of Turkish delights that was really nicely. I would really recommend everybody to choose exactly Adora Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff & location ... excellent value all round”
Reviews.Author: NellySays
Reviews.Content: Nothing but praise after enjoying a 5 day stay here. We wanted an economic, central, hotel and Adora certainly met those objectives, but to have such tirelessly friendly and helpful staff and a quiet location was a real bonus. The room was not large but perfectly adequate and spotlessly clean. As others have said the side street it's on is remarkably quiet overnight (in contrast to a hotel near Taksim Square used by some sleep-deprived visitors we met). The location is absolutely brilliant for the Gulhane tram stop, Sultanahmet sights, and Eminomu piers.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - a great find in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: kiwi-touring
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room at the Adora for 4 nights, and really enjoyed my stay. The room was on the small side but had everything you need, including a lovely clean en-suite bathroom. The included breakfast was great - a lot of variety and some Western options too. The staff went out of their way to be helpful, and were always cheerful. The location is also good, just 5-10 minutes walk from the main historical sites, and surrounded by restaurants and bars. Right on the tram-line too, so easy access to the whole city. Despite the central location my room was very quiet. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, handy location and reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: HenryAUS
Reviews.Content: I had the good fortune to stay here for 4 nights. Firstly let me praise the staff, especially Burhan and Åžeref, whom I mostly dealt with. The night staff were also excellent in this small sized hotel. It is less than 50 metres from the Gulhane tram stop. If you want to save some money you can catch a train from the airport to Zeytinburnu, and then hop on the tramway to Gulhane for under 4TL. The rooms were clean and comfortable, but not large, which is typical of most rooms in the older part of the city. I found them quite adequate for my needs. Breakfast was also included and sufficient. I have had breakfasts offered at other hotels with a greater range of foods, but I was happy with the selection provided. The room was quiet, despite the tramway being 15 metres away. Local restaurants abound in nearby streets. Having the tram nearby is very handy, and the ferries are only a short walk away. I recommend this hotel to you if you are on a budget and can get the rooms at a good price over the net.

Reviews.Title: “JUST PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: radetzki
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days in the hotel ADORA and I can only repeat what the others have said already: just perfect. Perfect location, extremely friendly stuff. Special thanks for everything especially to Erdi at the reception, he is the perfect man on the right place. If you push me to recommend an improvement to the hotel, I would say the breakfast. I would replace the sausage in tomato with an normal one (cooked or grilled) and soup with scrambled eggs. If IÂ´ll go to Istanbul next time I will deffinitelly book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Adora has a great location and even better staff..”
Reviews.Author: DanielNY
Reviews.Content: There were many good things about this hotel that not only made my stay pleasant but also made it easier to do things in Istanbul. First of all the location is amazing. This place was walking distance to all the important sites and is in a great part of Sultanahmet. In fact it is a great starting point because you are extremely close to Topkapi Palace and you can just start there and see the rest of the sites in the area in order. There is a breakfast buffet included every morning that had many good choices. To name a few things, hard boiled eggs, choice of cheeses, regular bread, sesame bread, sliced cucumbers, sliced tomatoes, butter, chocolate spread, honey and halvah. They also have coffee and tea. I really liked the fact that they had a 24 hour tea stand so you could get tea anytime day or night. Good choices with the teabags as well. Most importantly the staff was amazing. They called us taxis, told us how much we should generally pay for things in istanbul, called restaurants and made reservations for us, made us an early breakfast a day we had to leave early, and were just very pleasant and knowledgeable. It really felt like every person who worked there cared about your stay. They have a storage room for your luggage if you need to put anything there. There is a computer with internet in the lobby. Overall the staff is what really did it for me and I think this is especially important in a place where you don't know the language and may need help planning and navigating. They were able to answer all the questions we threw at them and our stay was really comfortable which is why we decided to stay there on more night on the back end before eventually going home.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: piket
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on our 3rd visit to Istanbul. The location is absolutely perfect: safe, quiet, but within walking distance of all main attractions and restaurants. The friendly staff couldn't do enough to make us feel welcome and be of service. Highly recommended. On behalf of Andries and Elbeth Liebenberg

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ephrance
Reviews.Content: Adora Hotel is 1 minute walking distance to the Gulhane tram station which conveniently connects you to all the best spots in Istanbul. Even without the tram, a slow stroll from Adora Hotel takes you to Gulhane Park, the Archaelogical Museum, Topkapi Palace, Ayasofya, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Binbirdirek Cistern. Bosphorus cruise, etc in minutes. Shops and restaurants are nearby and plenty to choose from. I mostly appreciate the friendly staff who go out of their way to accommodate guests. Many thanks to Edri, Burhan, Mustafa, Aladdin and company for their warm hospitality and excellent assistance during our stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff!”
Reviews.Author: Griek_11
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Cozy little room. Cute breakfast. Staff who welcome you with warm smiles. One morning we came down late for breakfast and Mustafa made us each a turkish coffee and patiently waited for us to finish. They even printed our flight tickets for us. Friendly man called Rumush who rides the shuttle is also entertaining and warm. Rooms are comfy and sparkling clean. Keep up the good work guys! Thank you ADORA!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: KarenWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights, and had an excellent overall experience. This is a great tourist-class hotel that is perfectly located for ALL of the major sights (but, thankfully, without being blasted awake by the morning call to prayer coming from the Blue Mosque). It is right by the tram stop, which, suprisingly, was pretty quiet, at least from the distance of our room's window. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating. My one complaint would be this hotel's particular interpretation of a Turkish breakfast. Ick. (At least the toast, the cucumbers, and the dried figs were good.)

Reviews.Title: “extra sparkling 3 stars for the ideally located, cozy Adora Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BurntOutBarista
Reviews.Content: After a long day of travelling we arrived at the Adora Hotel and were greeted with a refreshing complimentary drink and a big cube of Turkish delight. Just what we needed to perk us up after the journey. The man at reception was incredibly kind and helpful, issuing us with a guide book and a map, explaining all the local sites and letting us know that if we needed help with anything the staff would be more than happy to help. Our luggage was taken to our room which was a good sized double with bed, nightstands, wardrobe space, a (reasonably priced) mini bar, safe for valuables, dressing table and chair, tv and air conditioning unit. The decor is simple, if a little chintzy. The ensuite shower room was basic and clean. The bed was comfortable - mattress very firm. Housekeeping standards were excellent throughout our week long stay. Breakfast got a little tiresome on our 7 day stay, an array of meats, cheeses, breads, olives and fruit. I got the impression that smaller platters would have helped keep the produce looking and tasting fresher. The hotel is ideally located for all the major sites of Istanbul. Spitting distance to the Topkapi Palace and a ten minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Archaeological Museum and Hagia Sophia. Fifteen minutes to the Grand Bazaar - an amazing shopping experience where you can't help but barter and buy. A short walk in the other direction leads you to the banks of the Bosphorous where ferrys can cheaply and easily transport you further afield...to the Asian side or to Taskim Square and the awe inspiring Galata Tower. The tram line is also right outside with very regular service. The Adora Hotel is within the main restaurant/ pub area of Sultanahmet and their proprietors will constantly attempt to usher you in to their establishment. This could be annoying for some people but we found it all in good jest and some of the waiters banter provided fantastic entertainment. Besides, it's good to have a wealth of eateries to choose from near where you stay. Choose carefully though, we found price and quality varies massively from place to place. Despite being in this bustling area we found our room remarkably quiet and enjoyed sound sleeps every night. The hotel was undergoing some upgrades while we were staying but the builders were only in at times convenient to guests so this didn't disturb us. Ultimately, the Adora Hotel is an excellent stay and does exactly what it says on its own website. A solid 3 star with an extra special touch. The friendly, helpful staff certainly make it stand out from the crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: batyrbatyr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated near from tram. station "Gulhane" , where you can visit any places in Istanbul. The stuff of the hotel is very kind and cheerful. They helped us kindly. You can enjoy Turkish coffee, coffee and tea free in the entrance bar. If you visit to Istanbul, I recommend this hotel. Your trip will be much more enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: Irina_and_Igor
Reviews.Content: Travel to Istanbul became the first independent trip of our family. The impression of this interesting and beautiful city has been strengthened by a successful choice of hotel. Hotel "Adora" is located in the center of an old city, it is possible to reach the main sights on foot. And for Ð´Ð°Ð»ÑŒÐ½Ñ‹Ñ… travel by a number there is a tram, the ships and trains. Hotel very cozy, popular among tourists of the most different countries. The personnel here very precautionary and hospitable. In small to numbers there is all necessary. And in a hall meet tea and coffee. Separate thanks would be desirable to tell Burhan!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: issam_louhichi
Reviews.Content: Book a room with Adora hotel and you will never ever regret it. A good location in the heart of the historical square of Istanbul. walking distance (3 to 4 minutes) from Ayasofia, blue mosque and the hippodrome. Very helpful and gentlemen staff (to Burhon, Erdi and Umit thank you very much for making may stay very pleasant). The room is clean and big (I was in the room 302), nice TV (more than 700 channels), refrigerator full of good drinks. The breakfast was huge and amazing (salty & sweet as you like). I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and I am going back there in a near future.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, beyond any reproach!”
Reviews.Author: springfield_Slovakia
Reviews.Content: I don't want to sound too positive, but Adora was definitely one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. Firstly, the thing we were most impressed by was surely the staff - I've been to Turkey several times, so I know the notorious Turkish hospitality and friendliness, but these guys were even above the high Turkish standard. :-) Always with a big warm smile, ready to help you, caring, outcoming, from the manager to the receptionists. As for the hotel itself - everything great just as well. Room very nice, cozy and clean with facilities above the usual standard, bathroom big and very nice, the room service way better than the usual standard (the maiden maybe just should have cared a bit more about the floor, but no problem there), location great, the buffet breakfast perfect, and all those other small extra things only improved the impression - e.g. tea/coffee for free all day, PC with internet for guests, the fact that they served the breakfast for quite a long time (7 to almost 11). Highly recommended! For Slovaks and Czechs: naozaj vÃ½bornÃ½ hotel, veÄ¾mi peknÃ½, Ä�istÃ½, izby aj celÃ½ hotel vyÅ¡Å¡Ã­ Å¡tandard, personÃ¡l skvelÃ½, raÅˆajky super, poloha tieÅ¾, nie je Ä�o vytknÃºÅ¥, odporÃºÄ�am!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel lovely location and firendly people”
Reviews.Author: javadkhalili
Reviews.Content: adora hote is located in best place of istanbul . it's fit hotel to stay and enjoy the one of intersting city in the world.rooms are clean .the people in hotel are very firendly and helpful brekfast is perfect .you can get subway out of the hotel and go every where easly.

Reviews.Title: “really nice..”
Reviews.Author: popular_rhythm
Reviews.Content: rooms and serve was really nice..especially the receptionist erdi...yes..he was so interested and so funny ..but supposing that room price maybe little expencive...thanks for everything..by for now...

Reviews.Title: “If i went to Istanbul, i'd stay in "Adora".”
Reviews.Author: Inga_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed In Adora hotel for 5 days in january. This hotel has two indisputable merit: 1. very good location 2.incredibel polite and attentive staff. it is good place with all modern conveniences, wihtout excess. If i went to Istanbul, i'd stay in "Adora". Inga

Reviews.Title: “A very nice b&b-type hotel”
Reviews.Author: putthedoughouttocool
Reviews.Content: I and three of my friends followed the good recommendations of Adora hotel on Tripadvisor and stayed there for the entire duration of our 5-day trip, which we do not regret. We stayed in a triple room with an extra bed. I will just list a few points that I believe might be important for others: - The staff was very friendly, polite, and helpful. - The location is excellent if you want to do sightseeing in the old city, and is also well connected to the rest, as you just need to walk about 2 minutes to reach the nearest tram station (GÃ¼lhane). - The room was cleaned and the towels were changed every day. The beds were comfortable. The room was quite small (almost filled up with the beds), but the bathroom was of normal size and the room had a small extension with no beds and more free space, so overall it did not feel too small. - We did not experience almost any "technical" problem that people sometimes mention: we always had hot and cold water, the heating worked well, the door locked properly, we could open windows if we wanted. We just had one small table that was shaky and not really horizontal, but that's all. - The breakfast was quite diverse (fresh apples, very good dried fruits, 2-3 kinds of cheese, bread, milk, yoghurt, corn flakes, muesli, savoury things like bacon, omelette, olives etc), and most of it was fresh and of good quality. However, not everything was excellent: for example, if one of the main things you care about in your trip is the quality of meat products or omelette in your breakfast, I would probably not advise you to go there. But I guess for most travellers this is not the most important point. - The wireless was free of charge and the connection in our room was very good. There was also a computer with good internet connection in the lobby that could be used for free. What I could add is that during those 5 days we felt very much at ease there, almost like at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Best hotel service ever!”
Reviews.Author: Valkirja
Reviews.Content: I stayed In Adora hotel for 4 days in january. I loved the location,that was only a 5-10 minute walk to the most exciting historical sites. Everything was perfect in the Hotel! It's very beautiful and comfortable. The rooms were extremely clean and cozy. Reception needs to be mentioned separately: Me and my friends were met by the hotel staff very cordially with coctails. They presented to us very nice istanbul guide and turkish delights. The staff was really incredible, providing us with everything we needed. I will definitely stay at this hotel when I will return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Buxetroldia
Reviews.Content: The place is probably the best in Istanbul! We loved it at the moment of arrival. Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque are in 2 minutes of walk and all the neighborhood is very nice and safe. The room (as the entire hotel) was very lovely and clean. On the first floor there is PC with Internet you can use. I really liked the service they provided. The staff is very friendly and polite, they always greeted us with a smile. They also took care special requests appropriately. Overall I had great time there! I'll definitely stay in this hotel if I'm back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and good for value hotel”
Reviews.Author: sokaza
Reviews.Content: Very good staff, excellent service, very good location, clean hotel

Reviews.Title: “just perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: tzo038
Reviews.Content: we stay there for 4 nights and it was really a very good hotel!!!the best of all was the stuff, that was very friendly and very good at their job!!!the room was cleaned every day, it was hot, and the water was also every time hot!!!the location, also was very good, because it close to the most important sightseen.very good choise....

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: AlexaMardale
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Adora for 3 nights, together with 2 other guys and I can only say that I loved this hotel, regardless of the pretty small rooms and relatively poor breakfast. The staff was absolutely incredible, providing us with everything we needed (even free omelets in the morning). They were very friendly and prompt, especially Burhan who was always there to answer our questions. Furthermore, they managed to obtain a parking space right in front of the hotel for 15TL (app.â‚¬ 7.5). The rooms, though rather small and a bit chilly due to some radiator malfunctions, were extremely clean and cozy. The position of the hotel is wonderful, as Adora is within walking distance from all main sights of old Istanbul and cheap restaurants with great authentic Turkish food. I will definitely stay at this hotel whenever I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great hospitality in a great City...”
Reviews.Author: MrFezZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nigths though it should have been one more but due to Turkish Airlines that failed - but we weÂ´re totally charmed by this tiny yet very cosy hotel in a perfect spot if you want to see all the sights around The Sulhtanamet and have a short trip to the trains, trams & boats att EminÃ¶nÃ¼ - and still not take notice that youÂ´re in a 20 million-city! Cause i slept like a little baby but on the other hand i always do that but my travelcompanion didnÂ´t complain about sleepingproblems so guess it was OK... Never got around to test their food since it was only open during summerseason but a good turkish breakfast and a bar with snacks, Effes dark (best Turkisk beer iÂ´ve ever tasted) and local wine made the loss insignificant - and you donÂ´t have to worry about other places to eat out in Istanbul... One thing that wasnÂ´t good was the shower that could use some new parts since its waterflow was really slow but until next time iÂ´ll return they will surely have fixed it...

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel service ever-period”
Reviews.Author: Caravaneer7
Reviews.Content: I travel in Europe and Asia regularly. At the of a business trip I had a couple of days... As I was checking in I was served tea and Turkish delight - nice surprise, nice touch. The facility was smallish and very comfortable. I love the location only a 10 minute walk from some of the most exciting history every. The staff arranged a 3:00AM taxi for me to get to the airport early and, knowing I was leaving early fixed a special breakfast. I am not use to this kind of excellent service. Seems to me these folks want my business. And they will get it! When I am in Istanbul and work allows, will stay at Adorama. The service and hospitality are unexcelled in my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Adored Adora”
Reviews.Author: litanowells
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, within walking distance to 90% of attractions. Excellent breakfast. Great value and very helpfull staff. Room was very tini but as usual in most of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “what a nice helpful and wonderful Crew they are amazing”
Reviews.Author: Raba7
Reviews.Content: at the beginning i want to give a special thank for Adora Crew "team work" specially for Burhan , really he was a very helpful person reception me and my friend very very good any time i ask for help i found him front of me for helping second about the hotel its very Nice i like it but i have one Note its about the roof you should to use it during the winter because i wish to spend Night over there in the roof and because i am a sports man i hope next time found a Fitness Center or even a small gym this is my Not and i would say next time when i come to Turkey i will reserve in ADORA ADORA ON OF THE 10 REASON MAKE ME FALL IN LOVE WITH TURKEY THANK YOU ADORA

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: arazak
Reviews.Content: Excelent , the staffs in Adora Hotel were very kind and helpful and even offered my family and I on how to explore Istanbul without being asked.The room is spacious , clean and well decorated and located at very strategic area where you can visit many historical places within walking distance. The breakfast provided are good and very delicous.Since this was our first visit to Istanbul,we felt at home with the help of Adora Hotel staffs.My special thanks to your staff Borhan,Younus and Erdi for their kindness,friendliness and helps during my stay at your hotel.It was very wonderful moment to meet them and we definately will come back and stay at your hotel. Thank you and hope to see you again.

Reviews.Title: “great and cheap”
Reviews.Author: ameralmousa
Reviews.Content: i like the location as first,and after checking in,i loved the hospetality and the warm wellcome from the workrs,and then into the rooms,they are clean and fresh,phone, flat tv,many channels complete comfort and very good price if you ask me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonag
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a wonderful position in the city,the most important monuments are close, the block is quiet, and all the guys that work in the hotel are nice and they help you for anything; the rooms are clean and the breakfast is nice, a hotel to go and see.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: AlBeasley
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for sites around the old city. Tram station close Very helpful and friendly staff. Close to restaurants and markets We had a very enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet hotel in very good localization”
Reviews.Author: Anita_Gdynia_Poland
Reviews.Content: I highly recomand this hotel: nice, comfortable, with excellent location and very helpfull and polite staff (special thanks for Burhan - the receptionist)

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaTravelJunkie
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have traveled extensively and independently. We stayed at the Adora Hotel for 5 nights. We reserved twin beds thinking the room might be a little larger, as sometimes that is the case. Our room was the smallest hotel room we have ever had. It was tiny. The hotel staff was very pleasant, and breakfast was more than adequate. There is a computer in the lobby that guests can use free of charge. The Adora is conveniently located in Sultanahmet, and is close to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, etc. We considered this hotel a low level 3 star. Arizona, USA

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel & staff specially from a good & active guy mr. erdi”
Reviews.Author: haideralfadhel
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel & staff specially from a good and active guy mr. erdi

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat value and location”
Reviews.Author: Nick M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Adora on a flying visit to Turkey and the welcome and value here were fantastic. The rooms were European size however they were clean and comfortable.The staff were friendly right from the shuttle driver and welcome drink while checking in through to minding luggage while we went on a 2 day tour to Gallipoli with only our day packs. I think there are some signs of wear and tear beginning but the location in Sultanahmet and value are just great. This is a beautiful part of Istanbul and Adora is right in the middle of it, everything is in walking distance and ferries, trams and trains are very close if you want to go further afield. We chose the hotel based on Tripadvisor especially the helpfulness and service ratings and were not disappointed Hopefully we will have another chance to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Georgiy
Reviews.Content: Adora is located in the very center of Istanbul. The hotel itself is very nice and comfortable, and personnel are very polite. In the morning when we were leaving the breakfast was prepared only for us. Georgiy, Russia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra_jade
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, all staff were extremely helpful and polite. The room was very nice but parts of it looked a little worn. The breakfast was absolutely outstanding and so healthy. When I come back to Istanbul I definitley want to stay at the Adora again. I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “romance”
Reviews.Author: nikol000000
Reviews.Content: excellent stuff and location.the room needs some changes and more carefully cleaning the toilet the towels the beds and sheets.just this is not so good all the other are very nice and specially the stuff!!and location!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holidays in the ancient city”
Reviews.Author: Minun_matkani
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed very much our holidays in Istanbul. Adora hotel has an extremely fine location. It's suitable for people who value cultural factors during their holiday. Many lovely sights of the town are close to the hotel. The hotel is also cosy, quiet and not too big. We didn't hear any noise in the night during the week. The staff is skilled, friendly, polite and always ready to help. We enjoyed talking with nice young men (Burhan, Ãœmit and all others) in hotel. So we became familiar with the culture and life in Turkey. For us it's also important that there is a pleasant restaurant in hotel. Breakfast and food was very delicious. We will choose with pleasure this hotel when visiting Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Small little cosy hotel with excellent location, staff and service.”
Reviews.Author: alp-mia
Reviews.Content: Adora hotel is located perfectly in the centre of Istanbul, close to all "must-do-activities" and a nice bar/restaurant area. The staff and service is fantastic, everything is clean and there's free internet access etc. We visited the hotel with a small child, and the size of the normal double room is on the limit with bags, wagon and everything. Otherwise everything was great considering the price!

Reviews.Title: “exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: traveloverwife
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a few days. This place is a good representation of the local culture. Very comfortable room, walking distance to many historic places, and of course the kind and helpful staff. The friendliness of the front desk greet when I first stepping in that hotel, the comfortable and very cute decorated room and everything you need inside (hairdryer, minibar, etc), and the great selection of food in their restaurant. This hotel is a perfect choice for a tourist that visit Istanbul for the first time. I can assure the unforgettable memories that you get in Turkey should be completed with your stay in this hotel. Love the location, Five star service and exceptional staff. No disappointment, very recommended.

Reviews.Title: “the sweetness of comfort and kindness”
Reviews.Author: igalhano
Reviews.Content: In my last day s in Istanbul I decided to look for a hotel where I could have a good rest and nice people around me. This is the hotel I choose, advised by a friend, and I felt treated like a queen! As I had to go to the airport very early in the morning, a breakfast was made just for me... unfortunately I wasn't very hungry at 4.30 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel had an excellent location with extremely helpful staff and the room was very clean.”
Reviews.Author: hollywoodDubai
Reviews.Content: The room more than suited our needs with a clean bathroom. Hot and cold water. The location was very central, it allowed us to walk to many of the historical sights and restuarants. There was also a tram stop a 2 minute walk away. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and able to help out with any questions we had.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: luxtraveller88
Reviews.Content: A small mid range hotel in an excellent central location with extremely helpful and friendly staff. Good value for money. Not plush but clean and comfortable. We would definititely stay again. Burhan, Yunus and Erdi were all so helpful. The breakfast (included in the rate) is a bit average. The hotel seems to work with the restaurant next door for other meals and this seems very popular.

Reviews.Title: “TOP !! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED !!! Very cozy !!”
Reviews.Author: andihe
