Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Adora just supper and highly recommended! Small and cozy hotel with 15 rooms at top location. Good price / performance ratio. We stayed at the Adora Hotel 12 wonderful days in September 2010. Best location in the very heart of Istanbul. Every conceivable interest is to achieve very fast. The hotel entrance is located on a small almost traffic free road. Some rooms are in the rear with view on a small cemetery and some forward. For Istanbul standards it is a quiet area. The Hotel welcomed us with orange-juice and some sweets and tea (chay). Erdi and Yunus at the reception were like friends to us. Always helpful with advice and recommendations. We were treated very courteously. For that reason alone we would choose this hotel again. The most kind and helpful staff we have ever experienced. Also Sheriff, the waiter, served us with tea and other drinks every day, even for free. The double rooms are small but very clean. The somewhat hard mattresses on the beds were very comfortable, because we both have back problems. Room service embeds every day with fresh sheets and towels were also replaced every day. This is a service that you only get in 4 stars or above hotels. The bathroom is spacious. Even the transfer from an to AkatÃ¼rk-Airport was included. In the hotel there is also food that is cooked by Faros Restaurant. We found the food very good. Above all, it offers good value for money. Although the hotel has to my knowledge no stars, but offer a star service, we were inspired. We can only recommend it. In a word, just TOP!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with the perfect staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Olga070
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family in Adora hotel from 11-17 of September 2010. We really enjoyed our time in this splendid hotel which made our holiday so pleasant and vivid. The location of the hotel is fantastic! It is so close to all the main historic places of interest. There are so many cafes, restaurants with native cuisine and various shops close to the hotel... The rooms are very cosy, light and clean which are provided with everything you may need (minibar, hairdryer, slippers and etc). Me and my family felt as if we were at home during all our holiday in Adora hotel. It was so pleasant for us. We appreciate so warm hospitality, help and kindness of the professional hotel staff! Thank you very much for everything!!! I recommend Adora hotel to all my friends and relatives. And for sure whenever I am in Istanbul, I will stay only in Adora!!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT location, amazingly friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: sarah55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Adora hotel from Sept 11-13 2010. The location of this hotel is perfect - not more than a 5 min walk to many of the historic sights. The area boasts many lively cafes and shops, and we always felt safe. Although the rooms are on the small side they are very clean and well appointed. Who needs a large room when you have a vibrant city like Istanbul to explore? The breakfast was very nice, boasting a selection of hot and cold items such as meats, cheeses, breads, fruits, yogurts, eggs and tea and coffee. However, what makes this hotel special is the staff - they went out of their way to make sure that we were comfortable and had everything we needed. They were always friendly and ready to help. I plan to visit Istanbul again, and when I do, I will most definitely be staying at the Adora again.

Reviews.Title: “great location and very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Avinashpai
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the service offered. Burhan the receptionist is very friendly and helped me out a lot.

Reviews.Title: “I spent six days as a guest at this hotel and felt very comfortable there.”
Reviews.Author: peteraford
Reviews.Content: It is very close to a tram route with direct links to the metro system. All the staff were pleasant in manner and always ready to do their best to help. The breakfast buffet offered a wide variety of cold meats, cheese, salad items, fruit juices and bread plus coffee and teabag tea. On one occasion I ordered an evening meal and enjoy ed eating it on the terrace. I was not so comfortable eating outside in the mornings as the feral cats were bothersome. This is not the fault of the hotel. One suggestion - the demonstration on arrival of the use of the safe for valuables in the room and the use of the television could be carried out a little more slowly to be sure the visitor understands the process. Nothing about this hotel disappointed me and I would be happy to stay there again and intend to do so if I am able to visit Istanbul on another occasion.

Reviews.Title: “i"ll be back in a few weeks”
Reviews.Author: 154943Michelle
Reviews.Content: location, service, reliability, friendly staff particularly erdi, burham and ahmet. i am returning in a few weeks and booked here again. it made my trip to istambul fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: CatatonicZombie
Reviews.Content: The Adora is a great choice for a budget hotel in Istanbul. It's within easy walking distance of attractions such as Hagia Sophia, the Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque, as well as the ferry terminals at Eminonu for that romantic trip up the Bosphorus, and the tram line to central Istanbul. The staff are friendly and welcoming and happy to take care of any requests for you. My only caveat is: this is a fairly small place so is not really suited to large groups such as stag parties.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: mlievsay
Reviews.Content: This is a cute, small hotel in a perfect location to tour the city. The service and staff at the hotel were very accommodating and more than willing to help us with any questions/provide us with tips about the city. In walking distance from all the major sites- and the tram stops right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL WITH AMAZING, FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Australiancynni
Reviews.Content: The Adora hotel is a small but very cute boutique and great value hotel, located in a beautiful quiet cobble stone side street, in the heart of the old city. It is conveniently located within walking distance of most of the historical tourist attractions Istanbul has to offer. The tram stop is literally a one minute walk from the hotel and they come past often. The hotel is surrounded with many beautiful restaurants and various shops where you can buy Turkish carpets, ceramics, clothing etcâ€¦ The room was small in comparison to Australian standards but lets not forget that we are in a hotel that was built many many years ago. However, it was very comfortable and what mattered the most to me, was that it was very clean. So too, was the bathroom. The room had air conditioning, TV, a bar fridge, a safety deposit box, telephone and one even in the bathroom. Breakfast was great, with a variety of breads, fruit, cold meats, olives and cheeses as well as cereals and hot foods. You could go and get whatever you wanted and however much you wanted. It was very yummy. However, the best thing about this hotel is the staff. If you want warm, friendly, helpful and professional staff, then you are in the right place. I cannot express how fantastic they were. I was picked up from the airport for free, they greeted me with a cocktail and some turkish delight and took care of my luggage. They booked a tour, and organised an airport transfer for me, recommended places to see, explained how to get to places, what tram to catch and where to get off and they even spent an hour ringing different electronic stores to help me find a certain battery for my camera. Hows that for service! They were always there with a smile on their face no matter what time of day or night it was or even if they had just done a double shift. Erdi, one of the reception staff was truly amazing. He spoke english very well and even sat with me regularly to chat, and keep me company. I truly felt welcomed and safe. Thank you Erdi very much for making me feel welcomed. I would also like to say thank you to Burhan, Fikret, Ahmet and Mustafa (he's the waiter who is always extremely happy and makes you laugh) and the women who clean and serve (sorry, I didn't get your names). Thank you all for making my stay so wonderful. I will definitely be coming back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...”
Reviews.Author: Kosar2010
Reviews.Content: Great location, within walking distance of everything Istanbul has to offer. This hotel may seem small at first (most boutique hotels are), but the service and friendliness of the staff is very big and generous. The airport pickup was simple and they were very helpful with our luggage. Our room was very clean and the hotel management was very accomodating in letting us stay passed the check-out time to connect to a late flight. The staff spent time sitting down with us to explain the points of interest in Istanbul. Also, this hotel is located right in the middle many in-door and out-door restaurants, both expensive and inexpensive. Ferries, sight seeing buses and the local tram service were all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: VickyJMDublin
Reviews.Content: I really liked staying at this hotel, as the staff were very warm, friendly and helpful for the duration of our stay. They were overly helpful, even giving us maps and recommending routes to places we wanted to visit. The location is fantastic, really central to all of the tourist attractions and Sultanahmet. They breakfast was really nice and the hotel provided free Internet access, which is unusual in most hotels these days. They staff were fantastic, especially Erdi, Ilker and Sergan - very friendly and professional, and very hard workers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: BobnLoz
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel located in the heart of the old city. Within waling distance to most of the major tourist attractions as well as restaurants and shops. There is a tram stop around the corner to get to other attractions further away. Room was clean and comfortable - small by Australian standards but in line with other hotels in Turkey / Europe. Burhan and his staff were always friendly and helpful in recommending places to see, eat and with booking tours and transfers. Have since recommended this hotel to friends visiting Istanbul later this year.

Reviews.Title: “warm welcome with affordable rate”
Reviews.Author: ainuddin
Reviews.Content: Free pick up service from airport to hotel which not offered by most of the hotel.Nice greetings,courteous,helpfull and friendly staffs,good location to visit interesting and historical place,clean,near tram station.Great breakfast.The service was great with so affordable rate.Only the dustbin to small.Overall excellent

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: christine_shaner
Reviews.Content: Staying at Adora was one of the most memorable and best parts of an amazing trip. The staff is honestly the friendliest group of people I have ever met and always greeted us with free coffee, juices, water, and whatever else we could wish for. The hotel itself is situated perfectly for sightseeing and is literally a couple steps from the trams, but, being on a side street, it is still quiet and relaxing. The breakfast is really outstanding, with fresh fruits, yummy sausages, a variety of eggs, wonderful bread, and huge spread of olives, spreads, etc. This is an incredible value for the money and it is a really a pleasure to be able to write this review. If anyone at Hotel Adora reads this, Grant and Christine want to thank you again for your hospitality and warmth! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great and you couldn't beat it”
Reviews.Author: VanessaNash
Reviews.Content: Very lucky choice of hotel, excellent friendly staff, Erdr, Botul and Burhon, Fikret were all very helpful and made our stay most pleasant. The rooms were small but adequate and clean, airy and air conditioned. We would definitely go and stay there again when we visit Istanbul again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, poor maintenance and service. Look for other hotels in the same area.”
Reviews.Author: YuriD
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul and I can't compare this hotel with its peers, but by all international standards this hotel would hardly qualify for 3* as declared. Many hotels in the same area around Sultanahmet seem to be more solid. I'll just provide some facts we observed: - Room of weird configuration: main room about 8-9 sqm, plus an appendix of about 6 sqm with an extra bed. There are no windows in the room but only in that appendix. Uneven floor, floor moldings misplaced. Furniture and room/bathroom finishing have seen their better days. - Ants everywhere in the room. Don't leave any food or drinks open on your table - or otherwise in the morning you will find an ant-hill there. - Squeaky A/C hardly producing any cold - it was just about 30C outside and it was hardly doing its job. At night we had to switch it off because of tremendous noise. Wonder what's going to be if the temerature goes further up? - Safe and fridge are in the room but seems neither of these items were working. So were the remote controls for TV and A/C. The latter two were replaced upon request (apparently they just brought the remotes from some other room) - Very poor insulation in the room - you can hear all the sounds on the corridor and even neighbours talking on the phone in their rooms. You can also feel the shivering from the tramway, but that must be a common issue in the area. We were lucky since our room was facing an old cemetery (!) so at least no noise was coming through from the street. - Although very friendly, staff seem to do their job only when asked to. Cleaning was not their strongest skill. Rooms were not cleaned by 12:00 so several times the cleaning was skipped at all when we took rest in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel in nice location with kind and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 274887Kjb
Reviews.Content: Nice and kind service from all the friendly stuff (for instance Burhan and Ãœmit) and helps you feel comfortable in Istanbul. The size of the room is as usual in Europe and in a big city (that is to say, smaller than the ones you get in US for this money but larger than in Paris or London). Bathroom is nice and spacious. TV and WiFi - you can choose from many free services from the neighbourhood. Located in the centre of the old city by the tramline, close both to EminÃ¶nÃ¼, the Ayasofya area and Egyptian bazaars, everything basically is within a walking distance. Restaurant streets just in front but I recommend to go to the side streets. The Galata side and Taksim is just some minutes' travel by tram. Transfer from AtatÃ¼rk Airport by public transport is about 45 minutes and cosy ride.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: abumazar99
Reviews.Content: I recomand this hotel it is nice they have good staff frindely they like to help the guest in the hotel. like ( Burhan , fekrat , betul ,Erdi ). it is nice hotel in nice place .

Reviews.Title: “Great spot and lovely people”
Reviews.Author: Chichi1231
Reviews.Content: I spent 10 nights at Adora. The staff was friendly, helpful and professional. Room was clean and comfortable. Convenient location near all the historical sites. And I had excellent dinners at Faros Hotel next door. A truly wonderful stay at Adora.

Reviews.Title: “Dedicated service at the corner of Gulhane park”
Reviews.Author: RamiWithTiina
Reviews.Content: This Hotel offerd us home away from home. Easy to locate and travel to from most intresting sightsees due nearby tram. Just leap from the Topkapi palace and Blue mosque. Excellent personel with skillful language abilities and reasonable fares. Thank You Adora! -Rami & Tiina P.S. Next to this hotel lies the best food of the area ( Faros restaurant -> recommendations to eat there first to get good comparison to other restaurants)

Reviews.Title: “glamerous and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed_Mohd_Elsayed
Reviews.Content: I don't know exactly where to start.. Handsome front desk men and beautiful staff,, Near to all places specially the tram station where you can go anywhere easily and cheaply.. :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Renee1616
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in this hotel. The hotel has a perfect location in the old town, close to the sights, the railway station and a tram stop. Fantastic staff, extremely friendly and helpful! The bedroom and bathroom were both very clean. The sheets were changed every day. The room was not very big but the bed was comfortable. There was a nice television in the room with a lot of TV channels and air conditioning with remote control. The breakfast is great, a lot to choose from, and there is free coffee and tea all day. The computer with internet was very useful. Thank you Erdi and everyone else for making our stay so wonderful. I hope to come back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: melsaid1204
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the best. it is in the middle of all the attractions, staff were really helpful and friendly. i highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Our second home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Olga_Myakisheva
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have been to Istanbul 3 times and 2 times we stayed in Adora. The location is very good (2 minutes to tram station Gulhane), all sights of Sultanahmet are very close too. The rooms in this hotel are clean, comfortable, all devices work ok. Breackfast is tasty and various. And every time at the day you can drink tea or coffee for free. Stuff is very friendly and helpfull. I fell in Adora at home and can recommend it to everyone. OLGA, RUSSIA, MOSCOW

Reviews.Title: “excellent is a small word to describe it”
Reviews.Author: ElenaGabriela
Reviews.Content: I spent here 1 week 11-18 june 2010 and words are not enough to describe; I felt myself like at home

Reviews.Title: “convinient hotel for personal travaler”
Reviews.Author: AlexB_spb
Reviews.Content: convinient location and transportation.when you comin from tram on Gulhane enought uping your had and you'll directly see hotel anslag! not serches around necessery.This is mush important point in large cityes like Istanbul. very helpful and polite porties on recepcion(espesially Efdi).so quvalified stuff necessery to value.! free fulltime tea or cofe at lobio is nice pluse too. bit corruptet my positive apinion noisy resront romance under window of room. Alexey Belskiy (St.Petersburg,Russia)

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location....”
Reviews.Author: Joang33333
Reviews.Content: Location is really excellent and very easy walk to all sites. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. We were picked up at the airport with no charge. Room was very clean. Breakfast had big variety. Room was quite small but it didn't matter because we only slept there. Nice international clientel. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality and quality of service”
Reviews.Author: viaggiatore67Pavia
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a four day trip to Istanbul where we stayed at the Adora hotel. Mr Burhan and the rest of the staff made our stay very enjoyable and plesant. Rooms were very clean and a fantastic breackfast as well as meals served from the restaurant and drinks from the bar made the trick. Very nice indeed. The hotel sits just few minuts from the historical area of the old city and is wery well connected with public transport. I strongly reccomend it to everyone. Erminio

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Russelmak
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were simply wonderful especially Burhan who works the front desk. Staff even came to our room to assist us with my laptop when I had trouble with the WiFi. The rooms are spacious, beds very comfortable, bathroom very large, equipped with bathrobes. Our room in the back was very quiet over looking a large open area. The breakfast was more than adequate with a hot buffet, good selection of cheeses, olives, juices, vegetables and coffee/tea, breads etc. The location is very good, walking distance to many of the local attractions, close to waterfront and light rail train. Very good valve for price. Russel and Joyce, Edmonton, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Adora”
Reviews.Author: greektravelers
Reviews.Content: It really was a feeling of being at home away from home. The Staff and friendliness of the employees made the difference. We stayed for 5 nights and were pampered to all our needs by the staff. A special thanks to Ardie, who made thrip more pleasurable. Breakfast was good. Thank you Adora for making our stay very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: c_whaley79
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Adora Hotel for three nights, and they picked us up for free from the Istanbul airport. The staff were very friendly and accommodating, particularly Burhan. We had dinner in their restaurant one night and the food was quite good. The room was quite small but they had several hundred TV channels available. The hotel has an excellent location in the Old Town with easy walks to the Spice Market, T okapi Palace, and the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located hotel with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: TraveladdictLondon
Reviews.Content: Any hotel in Sirkeci near the tram tracks is difficult to access, and taxi drivers are none too knowledgeable even with written addresses, so accept the hotel's standard offer to collect you from, and deliver you back to the airport. The average price quoted on Trip Advisor seems higher than actual, so don't be discouraged by it, if your budget is less.. Hotel is perfectly located within 50 yards of the Gulhane tram stop, but the side street is quiet. Rooms are small but adequate. Restaurant is good for all meals. Laundry service is reasonably priced. Staff are outstanding, and the concern for the guests is so great that it provokes a hopefully equal response. This hotel did so much to make our 5 day stay in Istanbul fantastic. In spite of its 15 million inhabitants, Istanbul has many quiet and beautiful spots. It can also be restful to travel around, if one goes most places by tram or ferry boat. To avoid long queues, individual visitors to Topkapi and Dolmabahce should get there by 8.45 am, 15 minutes before the ticket office opens.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Bearcreekfarm
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Adora after two weeks of travel through Turkey was the best part of our trip! The genuine hospitality and personal care provided by the hotel and restaurant personnel was excellent! We hope to return some day! We adore the Adora!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended; excellent value”
Reviews.Author: RickE58
Reviews.Content: My family of three stayed 3 nights in this cosy, inviting and friendly boutique hotel. Free airport to hotel was awesome and the free wifi worked fine. The proximity of Aya Sofia, Topkapi palace, Basilica cisterns, Blue mosque and the obelisk were a plus point. Furthermore, it is located in a very safe area of Sultanahmet; and, is surrounded by eateries and other boutique hotels. The staffs are very friendly and helpful and guests can have a cuppa tea (called 'Chai') on the front terrace any time of the day FOC. The Gulhane electric tramstop is about 30 metres from the hotel. FYI, it is a very convenient way to travel around the city and cost a fixed 1.5Turkish Lira. Tickets (called Jeton) can be bought at ticket dispensing machines just across the road and it accepts up to 10TL notes. The ticket is actually a plastic token coin, and can be used on the funicular (connecting the last stop at Taksim area - Kabatas stop - to Taksim square). We liked it so much and wanted to book it for our return journey on the 21-24th April but it was fully booked, so we had to contend with our Hotel Venera booked earlier on (will review Hotel Venera after our stay there).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Friendly Personnel”
Reviews.Author: operova57
Reviews.Content: We liked the Adora Hotel. It is a good hotel as per its class level. Everything is comfortable inside hotel, good food, nice rooms, good services. We really liked the personnel of this hotel! The guys who work in this hotel are very professional, friendly towards their guests and always at your service! Good work! We have very best impressions about the personnel of this hotel! I'll advise my friends to stay in Adora Hotel. I'll be glad to stay in this hotel if I happen to go to Istanbul again! Thank you Adora Hotel! Olga

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dennis1204
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is located in Gulhane/Sultanahmet. Perfect for Sightseeing. Nightlife is also ok. Rooms are a little bit small and old furnished, but definetely very clean. On top is the service in this hotel! The whole team is great. Burhan from the reception and all others are very friendly, always smilling, helping where they can help and speak a very excellent english!!! Congratulations and compliment to the management for this team! Whatever you need, they can manage it. Even if you just want to make a short small talk, they take some time for you and you always feel very comfortable. Greetings from Carsten

Reviews.Title: “Good and friendly Hotel,”
Reviews.Author: pjuskeSkanderborg
Reviews.Content: My husbond and I both 71 years, stayed for 3 days in this place, and was very pleased with the friendly service. They welcome you. with a smile, and often asked if they could help in any ways Great service from Burhan and Erdi. and the rest of the staff. Hotel has a good location, close to everything, and the street car is a blok away. Breakfast was fine typical Turkish, with plenty of food. If we ever come back to Istanbul, we would defently stay at the Adora Hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: IneseAbele
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in an excellent location if you want to be close to all major tourist sites in Istanbul Center. Rooms are clean and comfortable. People who work at this hotel is a friendly, welcoming and helpful, with good sense of humor. Burhan ( the guy who worked in the Hotel reception) was just fantastic, because of him I have the best memories of Istanbul. ;)))

Reviews.Title: “Nice rest”
Reviews.Author: Risha-Risha
Reviews.Content: We had 5 nice days in Adora! Comfortable hotel in the centre of Istambul, tasty breakfasts, polite personnel especially mr. Burhoz :) who presented the box of turkish sweets to my daughter. Hope we'll back to Adora again!

Reviews.Title: “nice, friendly hotel with very good location”
Reviews.Author: airjumper
Reviews.Content: rooms were rather small but not too small, service in hotel was good and very friendly. Hotel has a fabulous location, hotel breakfast has "something to everybody". Hotel staff was unbeliavable friendly to us, our 14 years old daughter was at that time a little bit handicap because of her leg and the staff was so nice and understanding to her.

Reviews.Title: “An ok hotel with an extremely friendly staff and a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: PHeliks
Reviews.Content: DonÂ´t feel like writing clear sentences at the moment, so what follows here is only a list of +Â´s and -Â´s: + the staff was extremely friendly, words are not enough to describe them + the location of the hotel is perfect, thereÂ´s only a 5 minute walk to all the major sights and the nearest tram stop is maybe 100 meters from the hotel entrance + the breakfast had a wide selection of everything and it was fresh and good, not monotonous at all + the communal areas and the room were clean + the free internet connection at the lobby + free coffee and tea provided at the lobby - the double room was quite small - one night there was no water at all (which happened only that night and probably was due to a nearby construction work) - the rate they used converting euros to Turkish liras made us pay 10 euros more for our stay when compared to the official exchange rate

Reviews.Title: “Great location-price-quality combination”
Reviews.Author: ckosmas
Reviews.Content: Hotel was directly next to tram stop, extremely close to most monuments, and in general location-wise was very comfortable. Burhan and all other staff were extremely polite and courteous, hotel facilities were quite satisfactory for its class, price was just about right for us, and everything left us both very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: JohnBhoyTurkiye
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in various hotels around Europe and have yet, to find one as efficient and friendly as the Adora. We were greeted with a smile and that smile never left any of the staff during my 3 day stay. Rooms were spotless and large enough. Breakfast was more than ample. You could even have a head and shoulder massage at the table, after dining, from the friendly professional staff. From the manager to the bell boy nothing was to much trouble for them. I don't have shares in this hotel, but I wish I had, due to the professional customer first attitude. Oh and by the way it is within walking distance of all the main attractions, or, 50 mts from the very efficient tram system. Many thanks to all staff. John and Deniz from Glasgow/Didim.

Reviews.Title: “cosy hotel with a very good location”
Reviews.Author: kamich
Reviews.Content: i ve stayed there in march. it was quite cold outside, but in the rooms it was always warm, coz you can adjust temperature as you like. though twin room has a little problem for those who like reading in the evening - it is not light enough, the single room doesn t have such a problem. and now abount the most important advantage - excellent location - it s about 5-10 minutes walking to almost all of the most significant places of interest, tram stops, ferryboat docks. and it is very easy to find the hotel from wherever you find yourself. when you arrive very friendly guys will meet you. being always smiling and helpful they will answer any your question, will advise inetereting places to visit in the city and will explain how to get there. and personal thank to Erdi for teaching how to play "tavla" (backgammon, Ð½Ð°Ñ€Ð´Ñ‹). and i ve forgotten to mention free wifi internet with a good speed, it is very convinient for planning the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: ituo
Reviews.Content: Adora Hotel is truly great place. I really recommend it if you come to Istanbul for sightseeing holiday. The hotel is located near all the most important things in Istanbul, like Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Grand Bazaar. You can't praise the staff too much - they were very, very friendly, helpful and always with smile. Just lovely guys in there! They make everything they can to make you feel comfortable. There's free tea and coffee all day + nice breakfast. For some reason the Internet wasn't available by the time we were there, but it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: danae-amalia
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very close to the sights you would like to visit. 10 minutes walking to Hagia Sophia,Top Kapi,20 minutes walking to Blue Mosque, but you can also use the metro which is a few meters from the hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. we stayed at a room on the 1st floor but because it had double glass windows the didn't have any problem with traffic noice.The rooms are clean The breakfast is nice for a 3star hotel. it would be nice to have something different every day. Also,we booked a tranfer from and to the airport and they were perfectly on time. it was a good value of money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stuff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: estebang7
Reviews.Content: the location is excellent and this hotel has good value for money!!!very clean,always hot water,internet free.the breakfast was ok.free coffee and tea all day.But the different makes the stuff at this hotel.Erdi and Yunus was just great and with them Fikret and ilhan too!!always with smile and ready to do everythink to please you!!!!!!many thanks to you beacause you make the different at this lovely hotel!!Dont forget that the location is excellent.is near to the ayiasofia topkapi blue mosque!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean hotel in great...”
Reviews.Author: Mike_P777
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel in great location. Very friendly staff and amazingly good service. Fast response to emails inquiries. Providing 5 stars service with smile. I spent in this hotel just one day but for sure will be back again at the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Staff make this hotel great!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenReading
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Adora hotel over Christmas 2009. We were there for 3 nights and the staff left us with an unbeatable impression of the Turkish people. This hotel isn't expensive, and what you get for the money is a nice clean room, with everything you need (lots of hot water, television, good breakfast, free internet). It has a great location, with everything you want to see within walking distance and some nice restaurants to choose from (all a bit expensive, but then Istanbul can be). The staff couldn't do enough for us, printing off booking conformations for my onwards travel for free (even letting me sit behind the reception desk at one point), and helping us with everything we need. This wasn't motivated by money, they were just genuinely nice people. Subsequently I can't reccommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: nadiaaguilar64
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Adora last Jan 29 till Feb 5,2010. The place is close to all the sights you want to see, like the Blue Mosque, Hajia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and Basilica Cistern. Just five minutes to all these places. One minute walk to the tram station. Walking distance to the Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar. A lot of restaurants around the hotel and money exchange. Souvenir shops are also around the area. Breakfast is fine. Hot drink like tea, coffee are readily available. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Try the Turkish bath for more relaxing stay. I can recommend Adora Hotel. Though the rooms are not very big, but comfortable. The linens are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent are, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: katrin33
Reviews.Content: Adora hotel is near from Santasofia. Blue mosk and Topkapi palace. Hotel rooms was nice and they have really good breakfast open buffet in the morning. Clean hotel and friendly personal. We will come back to Adora.

Reviews.Title: “The best choice for price, location, staff and quality but not very luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Sultan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Hotels in Europe and Asia but I have never stayed in a place more pleasant than Adora Hotel. Denis, Aladin, Jafer, Fakrt and Omit were the best Hotel staff I have ever met; very helpful and kind. The bag carriers and Bar workers were also wonderful. The Hotel also ideally located which enable you to get easily to all prominent sightseeing, museums and good restaurants. Sultan

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: siemion
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Istanbul for two days. Adora Hotel was close to everything we wanted to see. Staff (all of them) was very welcoming and friendly. Room was small but comfortable, breakfast decent. I would eat dinner somewhere else as food and wine there was so so.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel at the right price”
Reviews.Author: gross0
Reviews.Content: Our room at this small hotel was large, comfortable, nicely furnished and the bathroom was large, well appointed (including hair dryer) and clean! This hotel has another significant asset - its staff - they are friendly, courteous, and very helpful. The hotel is located in the very heart of Istanbul's old city and a short walk to the Blue Mosque, Tapkapi Palace, the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Bazaar. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very firendly and helpful staff and comfortable hotel and restaurant for Sultanahmed”
Reviews.Author: ErdiODTU
Reviews.Content: I, my wife and 4 of my friends stayed Adora hotel for Istanbul 5 days Orienteering Event . The service is very nice and sufficient for everyone. The breakfast is very very good within this kind of hotels. And also I like restaurant and wine house of the hotel. The rooms are good. it is enough for travels. Beds are comfortable and it has toilet, hot water shower, hair drier. There are also minibar, satellite TV, wireless internet and . Most important, it is clean. The location is perfect. it is extremely close to the tram stop and you can go to boat harbor by walk (Eminonu) . Sultanahmed, Hagia Sophia, Golden Horn etc are within walking distance. I like the staff for very helpful and friendly attitude. The hotel amenities and rooms meet the comfort requirements sufficiently. Many thanks to Mr. Erhan, Mr. Otkay and Mr. Umit

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Northshore1
Reviews.Content: Great location, with short walking distance to all the major tour sites in Sultanahmet area. The Zeytinburnu-Kabatas Tram (Gulhane stop) is 2 short blocks away. The room is a bit small but we had no problem with 3 hardshell luggages and it has an individual air-condition and a small13" TV with 2 English channels. The bed was comfy and the bathroom was clean and spacious. The staff are very very friendly and helpful. The managers always offered tea to us when we return to hotel after a full day of sightseeing. The breakfast was fantastic with wide selections of hot/cold food & beverage. There is an Internet/computer for guest use and the elevator is small but really fast. Also, there is a supermarket about 3 minutes walk. Overall, we had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend this facility for value travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and Excellent stuff”
Reviews.Author: Atsuko38
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the center of historical spots and cloth to Tram stop so very convenient place. I could go to Sultanahmet, Sirkeci and Emononu easily. Everything was clean at the hotel. All of the staff were very kind and helpful..especially Oktay, I thank you for your help. I could stay there very comfortably. I would recommend this hotel for your trip.

Reviews.Title: “A cosy, small hotel,with a friendly staff, in the middle of ancient Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: vakantiedoel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 5-day stay in Istanbul, while the wheather was fine and the Adora hotel was the good "home" for us to explore this beautiful old city from. Highlights like the Topkapi Palace, en the Blue Mosk are within reach by foot, and little shops and bazars are nearby. Breakfast is served with care. Tasty and fresh. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Adora- that's splendid!”
Reviews.Author: irina54
Reviews.Content: Comfortable small hotel in the heart of historical Istanbul. Nice stuff trying to organize each wish of hotel guests such as turkish hamam and religious dancing men performance for example. Many thanks to Oktay and a boy who tried to do his best talking Russian language what is very important for Russian tourists cause Istanbul trips start to be very popular in our country.

Reviews.Title: “incredible”
Reviews.Author: oliverAbruzzo
Reviews.Content: we have been in this hotel for one week, and we have recived a very incredible welcom from the staff especially the guys at the reception desk Erhan and Otkay. They were very helpful in any information we asked and we found also very good-speaking English language. We felt like at home. The hotel is just 5minutes walk from all the main cultural attraction. Also the staff of the restaurant were very caring and always smiling . If you ever plan to go in this wounderlful city i would strongly reccommend this hotel for your journey. Dr. Luciano Torquati

Reviews.Title: “good value for money and very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: peet42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adora for 3 nights.The staff was very friendly. Location is very good if you want to see the Topkapi Palace, the Aya Sofia and the blue mosk. Very nice also is to visit the cistern. Al these highlights you can visit by foot from the hotel. Breakfast is average but you can eat outside, that is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, clean and friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Anna_in_Wales
Reviews.Content: We've just spent 7 nights in Adora; we chose this hotel because of excellent reviews published on tripadvisor and I'm pleased to say that it was a very good choice. It was all we needed. Adora had a fantastic location, just five minutes from Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Palace Cistern and many more; staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was clean and the breakfast was nice and varied. Oh, and after many hours of wandering around the city I really appreciated a hotel elevator:) They also provided free airport transfers, very convenient. If I ever return to Istanbul (I'd love to) I'd happily stay at Adora again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location and welcoming staff!”
Reviews.Author: Z64311
Reviews.Content: As a woman traveling alone, I was incredibly please with this hotel. Perfectly located in Sultanamet, only a couple of blocks from all the area's must-sees and the tramway making it very easy to get around. This hotel is clean and offers all the basic amneties required. The room is a little small but the bed was super comfortable and you don't come to Istanbul to stay in the room afterall. I would definitely return to the Adora Hotel on my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Adora became my most adorable hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Ganna_Kiev
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m totally amazed an impressed by staying in Adora hotel!I have stayed there for 4 nights and every day personnel of hotel was helping to make my staying there comfortable and really memorable! The hotel is designed as home-style hotel, very cozy and lovely. One can find everything necessary there â€“ nice breakfast, clean, lovely (even a bit small) rooms with conditioner (thatâ€™s extremely important in summer time!), computer with an access to Internet in lobby and wi-fi for travelers with lap tops, terrace where you can enjoy some drinks and dishes, sightseeing in 5 min walking from hotel, tram stop for further traveling but the most important â€“ great very friendly and helpful stuff! Special thanks to Erhan â€“ your introduction into Istanbul during my first day of staying was extremely interesting and helpful!!! You are the best adviser ever! What impressed me mostly â€“ stuff from Adora is always ready to help you not only in hotel, but outside as well if you need some help! For example, if one needs help in finding some particular shop or in bargaining, etc. â€“ one of Adora boys would easily accompany you showing the way and so on. Thanks also to Oktay for your great help! The location of Adora is also great â€“ walk to Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia would take around 5-10 min. I have been in about 25-30 countries all over the world, but I can definitely say that Adora hotel got special place in my heart, I would recommend it to everybody who visits Istanbul and come there definitely again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: rockstar3434
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 10 nights and remained comfortable the entire time. I was given a single room on the top floor which allowed in natural light since I wasn't blocked by opposite buildings. What made my stay wonderful was the attentive and helpful staff who really made me feel welcome and helped me arrange tours, directions, and taxis. The breakfast was plentiful and offered both hot and cold foods and the hotel's restaurant offers tasty dishes that can also be delivered to your room. The location of the hotel is perfect as its a 1min walk to the nearest tram stop, 3 min walk to Sultanahmet, and perhaps 10 min walk to Eminonu pier and Galata Bridge. My only complaint is that my television wasnt working properly and when I reported this problem it was never fixed. I didnt press the matter since I brought my computer and watched tv on it instead, but had I not brought my computer I wouldve asked to change rooms which I'm sure they wouldve accommodated.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little place with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: duncan30
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location within walking distance of all the main attractions in the area and the hotel staff are so friendly, polite, charming, helpful and hospitable. Only downside is that rooms are rather small but as you are out and about all day it really did not matter much. I would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: khayyam_2000
Reviews.Content: adora hotel was the perfect choice for me and my wife to spend a week in istanbul. and thanks to reviews on tripadvisor we found it. its location is perfect, steps away from a tram stop, and only 10mins walk from the best sights of istanbul. it is a small hotel with fairly small rooms but the bathroom is a very good size. it is clean and has excellent staff. the concierge are always smiling and happy to help, in particular erhan was very helpful throughout and was happy to advise on anything, and also was very helpful with the booking and emailed swiftly. the restaurant staff were very welcoming every morning and offered a good mixed breakfast which included continental style and a good choice of hot turkish items. the manager safit was always smiling and in a good mood and is always happy to sit with you over a cup of hot apple tea. we emailed the hotel through their own website and got a deal where we were picked up from the airport and dropped off free of charge. the cars were both large mercedes people carriers and were always on time. hotel also has a good speed internet computer free of charge most of the high level 5star hotels were on the other side of the golden horn which misses out on the true beauty of istanbul overall a great little hotel at a very good price, no pressure to tip anybody at any stage (very different from the rest of the city) which allowed you to pop a final one off tip in their box on the front desk at the end of the stay. highly recommended hotel and will certainly come back in future!

Reviews.Title: “Great place at Sultanahmed”
Reviews.Author: maritina73
Reviews.Content: Nice and cosy little hotel, superb location and nice and helpful staff. We stayed there for six days in a triple room which was wide, absolutely comfortable and clean. Situated in a little quiet street but near great monuments and close to the tranvia stop which allowed us to move around different districts. The only objection is that internet wifi didnÂ´t work properly, but that was not really a problem for us. We had a great time there. Regards from Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul -so much to see and so little time!”
Reviews.Author: niniLiphook_Hants
Reviews.Content: Four of us spent our Easter in Istanbul, staying at the Hotel Adora. We were made to feel very welcome by Erhan Adem Topalopl on reception, who sat with us, poring over a map of the city and giving us advice on our sightseeing trip. The hotel is situated very close to the Archeology Museum, Topkapi Palace, in fact very close to all the main sites with some lovely restaurants close by. All the staff here were so helpful and polite, from the waiter at breakfast to the manager. The breakfasts were buffet style with a good variety..and Halva, yum! Reception ordered a taxi for us on our return to the airport and it was punctual, even though it was 6am! Sad to leave but so pleased i'd looked on Tripadvisor and checked this hotel out...Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: oxgirl_9
Reviews.Content: I and two friends recently spent 4 days and 3 nights at Hotel Adora. We had a wonderful time and we enjoyed our time at the hotel. It is very clean, great location for site seeing. The staff where very helpful, particularly a staff member by the name of Erhan. Erhan went out of his way to help my friends and I find good places to eat and to visit. Totally recommend the Hotel Adora!

HotelInfo.Name: Adora Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Gulhane, Hudavandigar, Istanbul 34800, Turkey
